summary: The document is a compilation of intelligence reports and communications detailing the activities of Cuban intelligence officers, notably Rogelio RODRIGUEZ Lopez, in Mexico and other Latin American countries during the 1960s. It covers a range of operations including the shipment of explosives, training in subversion and guerrilla warfare, and the use of diplomatic passports for intelligence activities. The document also provides insights into the personal and professional life of Rogelio Rodriguez Lopez, including his assignments, movements, and interactions within the Cuban Embassy and with other individuals. Additionally, it mentions a meeting involving a European individual and Cubans, focusing on Panamanian elections and the international communist movement, which had little substantive outcome.
key_findings: Rogelio RODRIGUEZ Lopez is identified as a Cuban intelligence officer involved in various intelligence and operational activities in Mexico City.
The Communist Party of El Salvador's request for explosives shipment to Mexico was canceled after exposure of arms shipments to Venezuela.
Cuban intelligence operations included training Latin American nationals in subversion and guerrilla warfare.
Diplomatic passports and Cuban embassies were used in intelligence operations.
Coordination between Cuban intelligence and other communist groups in Latin America was noted.
Rogelio Rodriguez Lopez used pseudonyms and was involved in intelligence activities under Manuel Pineiro.
A meeting on an island involving a European individual and Cubans discussed Panamanian elections and the international communist movement with little substantive outcome.
